templates.name: Hypertrophy Foundations Upper/Lower
templates.description: Four to five day upper-lower rotation emphasising moderate volumes and progressive overload in the 6-12 rep range.

training_split.focus: Upper body hypertrophy with horizontal press priority.
Strength-biased lower session with hamstring accessories.
Pull dominant session to balance shoulder volume.
Glute and quad growth with controlled tempo work.
accessory_work: Rear Foot Elevated Split Squat 3x10 each leg

training_split.focus: Higher rep pump work to cap weekly volume within recoverable limits.

coaching_notes: Run sessions with 1-2 reps in reserve to manage fatigue and drive long term progression.
Rotate accessory variations every 8-10 weeks to maintain novelty while tracking compound lifts closely.
Match weekly set targets of 10-14 hard sets per major muscle group in line with evidence-based ranges.

templates.name: Strength Intensification Full Body
templates.description: Four day full-body layout blending heavy triples with secondary hypertrophy work for advanced lifters.

training_split.focus: High intensity squatting with posterior chain support.
Pressing intensity with horizontal pull supersetting.
Heavy pull with speed emphasis and posterior chain assistants.
Submaximal volume to accumulate bench practice and joint-friendly upper work.

coaching_notes: Wave top sets across weeks (heavy, volume, deload) to respect advanced recovery needs.
Keep 0-1 reps in reserve on primary triples while leaving 2 reps in reserve on supporting work.
Use objective velocity tracking or perceived bar speed to manage fatigue between exposures.

templates.name: Body Recomp Minimalist
templates.description: Three to four day routine built for lifters with limited equipment seeking simultaneous muscle gain and fat loss.

training_split.focus: Compound pressing with core density finishers.
Lower body strength with metabolic finisher for energy expenditure.
accessory_work: 10 Minute EMOM Alternating Swings and Mountain Climbers

training_split.focus: Pulling volume, posture work, and calorie burn.
Total body circuit to raise weekly energy expenditure without adding joint stress.

coaching_notes: Use rate of perceived exertion 7-8 on compound moves to leave headroom for incremental progress.
Pair each strength session with 7-9k daily steps to reinforce recomposition outcomes.
Prioritise protein intake of 1.8-2.2 g/kg body weight and keep a slight calorie deficit.
Add the fourth day only when recovery markers (sleep, soreness) remain solid.
